scope.in:
International relations / security studies and adjacent CS where constructs map to IR-relevant mechanisms.
Empirical or formal/theoretical work with explicit claims and evidentiary units.
scope.out:
Purely technical systems papers with no IR-relevant construct mapping.
Non-security social science not tied to interstate/coercive/strategic interaction.
scope.boundary_conditions: Unit of analysis must be explicit (state, dyad, organization, campaign, incident).

corpus.sources_consulted: Zotero library; targeted venue search; backward/forward snowballing; key dataset documentation.
corpus.selection_logic: Include influential/representative works and any study providing extractable evidence units (dqid).
corpus.provenance_note: All evidence units are traceable via dqid anchors linked to original citations.

dimensions.name: theme
dimensions.definition: Top-level claim family or mechanism label used in dqid coding.
dimensions.values: Derived from dqid theme field; normalized via humanization.

priority_gaps.label: Sparse evidence on cross-case comparability
priority_gaps.description: Few items explicitly test how attribution confidence varies across regimes/contexts using comparable measures.
priority_gaps.rationale: Limits generalization and policy inference; blocks meta-analytic aggregation.
priority_gaps.suggested_design: Construct harmonized coding + shared outcome scale; pre-register identification strategy.
